security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill with read-only tools (Read, Grep, Glob). All static findings are false positives triggered by instructional content describing what security issues to look for. No executable code exists. The skill explicitly declares read-only operation and includes guardrails against exploiting vulnerabilities.

content.user_title: Audit code for security vulnerabilities and risks
content.value_statement: Manual security reviews are time-consuming and may miss common vulnerabilities. This skill systematically checks code for command injection, permission issues, and exposed secrets using read-only analysis.
actual_capabilities: Review command execution code for shell injection vulnerabilities
Check tool permission configurations for bypass risks
Audit secrets management for hardcoded API keys
Analyze WebSocket endpoints for authentication gaps
Review frontend code for XSS vulnerabilities
Generate structured security reports with severity levels
limitations: Read-only analysis only. Cannot modify or fix code automatically.
Requires user approval before implementing any fixes
Limited to static code analysis of the current codebase
Cannot detect runtime vulnerabilities or dynamic issues

use_cases.title: Pre-deployment security check
use_cases.description: Run a comprehensive security audit before deploying code to production environments to catch critical issues early

use_cases.title: Third-party code assessment
use_cases.description: Identify command injection risks, permission issues, and exposed secrets in external or vendor code

use_cases.title: Code review security checkpoint
use_cases.description: Add automated security checks to your code review workflow before merging pull requests

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security audit on this codebase and report any critical vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Command injection review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all command execution patterns in the backend code and check for shell injection vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Secrets audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this project for hardcoded API keys, passwords, or secrets that should not be committed to version control

prompt_templates.title: Full security report
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security audit including command execution, tool permissions, secrets management, WebSocket security, and frontend vulnerabilities. Generate a detailed report with severity levels.

output_examples.input: Run a security audit on this codebase
output: Critical: Shell injection risk found. User input concatenated into system call.
Critical: WebSocket endpoint lacks authentication middleware.
Warning: Environment file not listed in gitignore.
Warning: Secrets loaded without using dotenv library.
Recommendation: Use parameterized commands instead of string concatenation.
Recommendation: Add authentication to all WebSocket endpoints.
- config.py line 15: API_KEY variable contains literal string value
- settings.json line 8: Contains database password in plaintext
Recommendation: Move these values to environment variables.
Recommendation: Add these files to gitignore if they contain secrets.

best_practices: Run security audits before merging code involving command execution or secrets
Address critical findings immediately and warnings before production deployment
Use this skill as part of your regular code review workflow
anti_patterns: Ignoring audit warnings for internal or trusted code
Running audits only before major releases instead of continuously
Implementing fixes without understanding the underlying vulnerability

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code, Claude, and Codex. It requires Read, Grep, and Glob tool capabilities.

faq.question: What security issues can this skill detect?
faq.answer: It checks for shell injection, hardcoded secrets, missing authentication, permission misconfigurations, and XSS vulnerabilities.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This is a read-only analysis tool. It recommends fixes but will not make changes without your explicit approval.

faq.question: Is my code safe during the audit?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only uses read-only tools and never logs, stores, or transmits discovered secrets or sensitive data.

faq.question: What should I do with the audit findings?
faq.answer: Fix critical issues before deployment. Address warnings when possible. Implement recommendations as ongoing security practice.

faq.question: How is this different from automated scanners?
faq.answer: This skill provides context-aware analysis using AI reasoning with specific remediation guidance tailored to your codebase.
